inn1.comm: back of a length, defended into the off side from the crease, right up on his toes to get over that
short again, Parchment back and drops the ball a few feet into the off
half forward and pushed gently into the on side
slower, back and patted back to the bowler
through Parchment and a loud yell from Pollock but that was heading down the leg side
forward and defended
down the leg side, flicked fine and four all the way
outside off, no shot and the ball rips through to Boucher who takes it at chin height and it was still climbing
on leg stump once more, it thuds into the pads and dribbles into the leg side
outside off, left alone
turned from middle and leg past a diving square leg, good running as Pollock did not have too far to run round at long leg
two feet wide of off stump, Smith not tempted
squirts off the toe of the bat to the left of second slip, third man mops up.
driven into the ground and Duminy dives to stop, a crowd-pleasing bit of acrobatics which might not have been entirely necessary
too short, too slow and hammered over midwicket
worked into the leg side and again Steyn forced to earn his keep
a good leave, not too wide but he judged it to perfection
overpitched but the drive comes off the toe of the bat and lacks any oomph
outside off, left
slower and fuller, outside off and no shot
very wide outside off and this time it's called, again Boucher takes it on the rise though
similar delivery but just within the tramlines
patted a few feet into the leg side and a well-run single as square leg dives with the aim of an underarm shy but doesn't pick up the ball
a thick edge into pads as he shapes to flick through midwicket, a run anyhow as it goes behind square
dropped into the leg side
just short of a length, the batsman can do no more than push into the off side
pulled but not timed, it beats midwicket but Ontong chases hard and brilliantly dives and flicks the ball back an inch from the boundary
a really Caribbeanesque pull but he misses and the ball goes through to the keeper
slower, fuller and straighter, Smith defends
super line and length once more from the old warhorse, Smith content to pat the ball back
an across-the-line swish, its thuds into the pads and the appeal is not that convincing
Chanderpaul walks across to the off side, nicking it to leg
lovely stuff, short outside off and Parchment goes back and then opts to pull his bat inside the line
pushed to mid-on and a well-run single. home and dry even if the throw had hit
slower outside off, he will be relieved to have got away without that being called wide
the breakthrough and a limp shot, angled across the left hander, Smith aims a loose drive with anchored feet and the ball goes to first slip at an ideal height
firmly forward and pushed to cover
forward but taken on the pads and not bat
steered to backward point
that one beats a push outside off
slightly too short, he steps back and cuts that hard through the covers, a sweet shot
he starts ambling down the pitch, Pollock sees him and drops the ball short, it thuds into his thigh pad and out to the covers
worked neatly behind square on the leg side
a peach, it seams away from Parchment who goes back, is turned square and is well beaten
a brace of peaches, again Parchment forced back and the ball swings wildly to leg after passing the bat
outside off, left and the ball arcs significantly towards the slips after passing the batsman
three peaches ... a veritable bowl of fruit ... short, seaming and Parchment beaten once more.  Boucher has taken all three on the rise as well, outstanding bowling from Steyn
fuller and pushed back, Steyn fields and then hurls the ball at the striker's end, misses by a mile and Boucher has to leap to his right to prevent overthrows
turned behind square for a single, a low-key end to a superb over
outside off
steered with an open face to third man

a massive shout as Parchment falls to off as he looks to play across the line and is hit back in his crease, Koertzen wastes no time in raising the finger, albeit it's severals seconds before it is in its final position
off the mark with a nurdle to fine leg
left alone
a rather indeterminate poke and the ball beats the bat
slightly short, pushed to point, Nel follows through to within four or five feet of the batsman who is having nothing to do with him
sweetly clipped off his toes, just behind square and no way can fine leg get round. Nel snarls, mutters and then snarls some more.
and again Nel drifts to leg and again Chanderpaul milks one of his favourite shots, past square leg
an inside edge to  a loose drive and the ball creeps past his off stump
he walks down the pitch, misses with a poke and there's a loud appeal from all and sundry for the catch behind. It didn't look close and the umpire agrees
he steps to the off and plants the ball into space on the leg side
outside off and that climbed to Boucher. There's life in Pollock yet ...
gentler, slightly wider and Chanderpaul leaves
he's happy to leave the ones angles across him
same line, this time he has a poke and a miss
back, into line and poked to point
swinging down the leg side
lovely response, outside off swinging away, he whips the bat inside the line
good line to the right hander who comes prodding forward and is beaten with a touch of away swing
straighter this time from Nel and Samuels tucks it off his hip rather neatly
cor, that's a blinding stroke from Chanderpaul. Onto the front foot, he drives this just in front of square for four. Exquisite timing
Chanderpaul walks into this defensive stroke, and with a high front elbow he punches to mid-off
too wide and ignored outside off
rubbish. Down the leg side and rightly wided. Next
another waste, down the leg side and he tucks it through midwicket
good line, left alone outside off
a guttural appeal from Boucher; nothing more than a hopeful raise of the arms from Pollock as Chanderpaul's rapped on the pads
good ball, excellent length. He was unsure whether to come forward or go back, and was stuck in no man's land, inside-edging it into his pads
cautiously onto the back foot, he beckons this through midwicket with a careful tuck off his legs
and Chanderpaul comes shuffling forward, pulling his bat inside the line
again Chanderpaul does his best Jack Russell impersonation, coming forward before dragging the bat inside the line
firmly defended on the front foot
hammered! No feet movement - and nor did there need to be. It was a half volley, Samuels cracked it down the ground for four
over the top this time but he hasn't quite timed it. Samuels thinks it's going for four, but the outfield is still very moist and, with poor running, they only get two
bowled him! A horrid shot, trying to cut this straighter ball. It was too close to him, and he drags it on
good ball, nipping back off the seam and Morton tucks this to leg
pushed out to cover
firmly defended on the back foot. Encouraging swing
turned to leg but Duminy is quickly around the boundary, flings in an excellent throw and prevents two

a touch outside the off stump, Chanderpaul comes forward and the ball balloons off his pad before flying to point. They appeal for lbw (outside the line) and a catch (nowhere near the bat), but Rudi shakes his head dismissively
left alone outside off
too wide and ignored
a shorter one which hurries Chanderpaul, but he rides the bounce and fends it safely to leg for a quick single, stealing the strike
here's Nel, charging in and almost overstepping the wide mark. Awful delivery, and his wry smile suggests he knows he has got away with it
Chanderpaul walks across to the off side, nicking it to leg
wide enough to be left alone
excellent ball which hurries Morton. Nice and straight, too
a waste down the leg side
punched out to mid-off
a nice outswinger which he leaves well alone
too straight, Morton tucks to leg for a quick single. Good running
good carry there, Boucher taking it at face height
very good ball, swinging into Chanderpaul who plays it well though, drawing his bat inside the line
driven on the up but only for a single
really well bowled, angling into the right hander before straightening at the last moment. He's rapped on the pad and it balloons out to the off side
what a ball! It cuts back into Chanderpaul, beating him comfortably...Nel sinks to his knees and barks an appeal. He sounds as though he's been shot. The umpire, Harper, can't contain his laughter
gone this time! Short and wide, a filthy delivery but Chanderpaul matches the poor ball with a terrible stroke, cutting it straight to point
down the leg side again from Nel, Bravo tucks it to leg
confidently forward and he defends
short, wide and slow. Morton slaps it past point
whipped through midwicket to steal the strike
nice shape away from the right hander, but he leaves it well alone
wild and woolly, rightly wided by the unwide umpire
again, plenty of outswing but it's too wide
and he's got him! Another outswinger, Bravo wrongly decided to whip it through his favoured leg-side region and gets a thick inside edge. Boucher, diving to his left, does the rest
lovely outswinger, Ramdin is driving this crisply out to cover
oh dear. He wafts at this wider delivery, missing it by an inch. What on earth was he thinking? A weak, loose waft
better stroke this time, pushed out to cover
beaten. A nice away-cutter which moves away from his forward poke
driven on the up but he splices it, and Nel cleans up in the deep
left alone outside off
good line outside off, a little too short though and he persuades it to leg
shorter ball, fended out to cover
nice shape but he punches it crisply to mid-off for a single. Good running
another lovely outswinger; another horrible shot. They can't really cope with the swing here
ooh that's another good ball, pitching on middle-and-off before swinging away. He plays it well, cautiously nurdling it
a real humpty dumpty waft and he gets a thick inside edge
angled down to third man
inside edges this into his pad
big shout for lbw but it's down the leg side
clunked on the up to long-off
defended off the back foot, it's dropped down by his toes and they scamper a desperate single
another one! Good line outside off, but too short to be driving and he gets a thin edge through to the keeper
turned to midwicket and they run through for a single
whipped to leg, but they're in trouble here! Sammy's slow out of the blocks and here comes the throw from Pollock at a deep mid-on...but it's wide
neatly timed out to deep extra cover
nice line, but he leaves this alone outside off. Good, teasing delivery in the channel
flayed on the front foot past de Villiers at backward point. Not far away at all - spectacular dive from de Villiers
fine ball which squares him up, but he plays it late out to cover. "No, Sammy!" Morton shouts from the other end
well wide and well left
drifting into his pads
good end to a tight over as it's defended solidly
that's a corker from Morkel. A morker, then. The perfect line and length, drawing him into a wafty poke outside off, and a touch of nibble off the seam beats him
guided out to cover
short of a length, he's onto the back foot and pulls it...straight to the fielder
nudged off his pads
excellent delivery which squares him up. JP Duminy comes flying in from cover - quite literally - but lets go of the ball a bit late, and it misses the stumps by about two metres
punched out to cover
what a ball!  Fast, beating his defensive prod...if only it was straight
again too quick for him and he plays and misses
good awayswinger but it's full enough to be driven, and it takes the thick outside edge down to third man
down the leg side and he flicks down to fine leg
an edge and he's caught behind! No...I'm sure I heard a noise, but no one else did. Brilliant ball once again, just moving off the seam
another fine delivery which spears into his stumps before swinging away. Comfortablyish defended on the front foot
too short but a good line, and it hits him high on the thigh
nicely defended off the back foot, ala G Boycott - just dropping it down by his  toes. They scamper for a single
too straight this time and he turns it to leg for a quick single. In fact, they've clearly had some Weetabix or something as they're going for two...and they get two, in spite of Ontong's good throw
ignored outside off
sweetly struck but Duminy pulls off a fine save at short mid-off
back-cut to third man
fast but wide of the off stump
elegantly cut, riding the bounce nicely
defended
fast and full, he chips to mid-on who's wide...Langeveldt sprints in but his throw is also wide
nice outswing and he plays and misses
oh a beautiful delivery which bends away from him at the last moment, and he follows it with an awful, wishy-washy drive. Should've played it off the back foot
shot. That's more like it. Strayed onto his pads and he whips it through midwicket for four
guided out to point. In comes the throw, misses the stumps, and they might get overthrows...but they don't
wide of the off stump and ignored
poor ball, down the leg side
a beauty which squares him up as Sammy tries to work it to the leg side, but he gets a leading edge
worked around the corner
oh, hello - that's a fine stroke. It was in the slot and he spanked it over the top for four. Top  timing; top spanking
flicked to midwicket
guided out to point
Nel appeals: "Arghhhhh" but Rudi shakes his head. Nel stands there, puts one paw up and roars another guttural plea. "Arghhhhhhhhh"
punched out to cover
good ball, angling into the right hander who digs it out
smudged to midwicket with a closed face of the bat
punched out to cover
down the leg side, swinging further that way. Flicked for another single
a full toss which is whipped through midwicket again
tries to defend this but, with a horizontal bat, rather chops it down to the off side for a single
top shot, a front-footed chop behind square for four
back of a length and slapped straight through mid-off, long-off can't stop the two and Nel does a tea-pot in his follow through
ooh, nice and full and he inside edges it. Boucher collects the pea-roller
firmly blocked out
he back cuts this and sets off for a run...Boucher collects and aims at the stumps, but misses
an attempted slower ball down the leg side
he has absolutely hammered this but de Villiers saves four with a fine stop, falling to his right
plays and misses outside off
a huge heave through midwicket but only for a single
swing and a miss outside off
full and straight, he squeezes it out on the front foot
off his pads and they scamper a leg bye
nudged to leg and they steal a single
hammered on the front foot out to long-off. They run one, they run two and here comes the throw...but he intercepts it with his body! Top intercepting
a full toss which he clobbers on the front foot out to long-off. The throw is weak and wide...awful throw, in fact
another full toss, he swings it behind square on the leg side but not quite fine enough
excellent yorker! Almost cleans him up
full toss, he tries to smash this over the top but it's falling down Botha's throat at long-on...but he spills it! What a clanger that was
bang! That's a beauty. He's absolutely nailed that. It was full, just outside off and he carved it over long-off for six. A flat six
drifting down the leg side
another poor ball, again down the leg side and they run a leg bye. Boucher's throw is, for about the fourth time today, miles wide of the stumps
a full toss which he smashes down the ground. Pollock, at long-on, finally sends in a good, flat, hard throw to Boucher who does the rest, in spite of Morton's dive
fine ball, swinging into Rampaul, the left-hander, who digs it out
good bouncer. Rampaul ducks beneath it
tentatively tucked to leg
swinging into the left hander who tries to cut it
miles down the leg side
he reads the slower ball and swings it around the corner
ping! That's a beautiful pick-up from Sammy. Angling into him, he just picked it over the boundary for six.
monstrous! That is absolutely massive. Another full toss, and he almost knew it was coming, taking half a step down the pitch and again pulled it for six...over the crowd and out of the ground
pulled through midwicket once more
down the leg side, swung down to fine leg
clumped to leg and there's Sammy's maiden fifty. Good knock, that.
oh so close! That was millimetres away from taking out his off stump as Sammy tried to work it to leg
a slower ball which he works to leg, off his pad, and Boucher underarms it, hitting the stumps, but he's safely home
and he nudges this to leg, scampers through for a single to give Sammy the strike...but he's miles out
clunked down to long-off and he calls through for two...but the throw is flat, hard and Sammy's short of his ground
bowled him! He steps outside leg, tries to bash it over midwicket but the ball deflects off his pad onto his stumps

inn2.comm: Smith goes on the pull but he's going home on his own
squeezed off a thick outside edge down to third man
nice shape away from the right hander, squeezed out on the front foot to cover
very well bowled, angling into de Villiers who punches it back past him
good length but a poor line and de Villiers easily nudges a single to leg

bowled him - his middle stump is flattened! A dreadful shot from Smith, trying to drive this wider ball but he didn't move his feet an inch. Consequently, the bat arced down from first slip, dragging the ball onto his stumps
good straight ball which he whips to leg
nice and full, turned to leg
swinging away from the right hander who is cautiously behind it, pushing it out to cover
beaten by a corker! Late outswing away from the right hander who tries to drive on the up, but is beaten by the movement. Again, no feet movement...
oh a cracker again - a touch shorter this time and Kallis, off the back foot, pokes and misses
too straight but Kallis's nudge goes straight to mid-on
too full and really sweetly timed out to mid-off, but straight to the fielder
left alone outside the off stump. Good channel and a useful length
a touch too straight allowing de Villiers to pull...but in fact, it slid onto him quicker than he expected and came off the pad
beautifully driven once again to mid-off
a testing line outside off. Kallis clips it with neat timing to point
well bowled - nice shape away from the batsman who ignores it...wisely

good catch! Fine bowling from Edwards, as de Villiers tries to pull this from outside his off stump but skies it over point's head. Samuels circles beneath it,  steadies himself and takes a really good catch
ignored outside off
fuller this time. Clipped out to cover
back, across and he defends
bosh! An extra cover drive, on the up, for four. Emphatic
full, straight and bashed back to them
oh that was close. Duminy was well back in his crease, but it was a quick ball and cut back sharply on him
top bowling! Powell angles this across Duminy, the left-hander, who fishes and misses. Touch of bounce there, too
and this one cuts back
swinging into his off stump, he confidently drives to mid-off
ooh that's close, but it pitched outside leg. Half a shout for lbw as he raps him on the pads...good, quick, straight delivery
he tries to turn this through midwicket but misses
another confident drive through cover, on the up, though without the timing which brought him his last four
speared into his feet, Kallis clips it to leg for a single
ooh that's a poor stroke from Duminy, almost akin to Smith, as he tries to drive this off-stump delivery through the covers but the face of his bat closes...and the ball squeezes past his stumps
a crackerjack snorter! On the back foot Kallis poked and prodded but was beaten by a fine leg-cutter
well bowled, on off stump, but equally solidly defended
poor end to the over, down the leg side
wristily clipped to leg
a waste, down the leg side and not even Ramdin can collect
sweet shot from Duminy. He's timed the backside off that, clipping it through midwicket with the most economical of flicks
he climbs into a cut but finds cover
onto the front foot, he elegantly cracks this to mid-off
short, pulled to square leg
full, on his leg stump, it's turned around the corner
another corker from Edwards - too fast, swinging into Duminy and it kept a touch low, beating Duminy's ambitious drive
firmly driven to mid-off
well wide of the off stump
oh well bowled! He only just jabbed down on that at the last moment. It swung in and he dug it out
good line and length. Duminy, though, is solid off the back foot
excellent line, just outside the off stump and Duminy defends...but he's a little too late on it and inside edges it onto his boot
ah, shame. Down the leg side
angled across the left hander
turned to leg
short and dispatched. A solid, thumping pull stroke in front of square, swivelling on it nicely
a beautiful cover drive. He absolutely laced it, but Bravo did well to stop it to his right at mid-off
drifts down the leg side and a big appeal as Kallis flicks at it...but it's not out. There was certainly a sound there
well, what a ball that was. Remarkable tennis-ball-like bounce which Kallis evades and which Ramdin had no chance of taking
a fast yorker, just outside his off stump, bending back in
he's rapped on the pads but the umpire shakes his head. Looks like it was going down leg
watchfully blocked out
top shot. A pick-up for four through midwicket. The timing...
beaten by a beauty, again Kallis plays and misses at an outswinger. Excellent ball
firmly defended on the front foot
full, driven to mid-off
lovely placement, a half volley caressed through an off-side gap, and there are plenty when the bowling is at this pace
better, Duminy back and pushes defensively to leg
shapes to flick to leg, misses, the ball squirts off the pad and an easy single as Ramdin chases
loose, straying to leg, worked into space on the leg side, the man in the deep has a long way to run round to gather
nonchalantly driven to the left of mid-off who has to dive to gather
outside off at 127kph, no shot
Kallis steps to the off, it's straighter than he thinks and he takes a blow in the solar plexus, momentarily doubling over
good bowling, Kallis forced back and he can do no more than poke into the off side
again blocked, but with an open bat and that steers the ball wide of backward point
tip and run to Bravo at cover, it was tight but the throw was poor and Duminy never in trouble
Kallis again walks to the off side, working a shorter ball down to third man
turned to midwicket, "oh yes," shouts Ramdin
defended to backward point who can't gather it despite a sprawling dive, third man ambles in to field
too full, driven but not timed to deep cover
slower ball, driven back, Sammy drops to his right to make a sharp, one-handed stop
misses as he shapes to turn to leg, the ball drops from his pads to his feet
half forward to defend
firm drive to mid-off, his hand slipping off the bat as he plays it
slight swing into Duminy, he takes it on the pad and a half appeal from the bowler
short, pulled but not with any conviction, it bounces ten yards short of the man in the deep
checked drive short of mid-off. The yell of "catch it" was wildly optimistic ...
pushed into the off side
turned to midwicket, all pace taken off the ball and they complete a tight run without any alarms
pushed from the crease to point
back and angled 20 or so yards towards third man. Kallis almost walks the single.
checked drive to extra cover
slower ball, driven up to long-on
too short, Kallis back and helps that on its way, rolling his wrists and with the man up in the circle, its four all the way
steered to backward point and a good stop
open face and Kallis happy to milk the third-man region all day
that changes things and some. Short, Kallis looks to work it to leg but rolls his wrists too early, gets a top edge and all Ramdin has to do is go back five yards and wait for the ball to come down
defended on the walk
down the leg side
pushed into the covers
driven into the pitch and the ball bobbles back to Rampaul
looks to work to leg but plays too early and takes the ball on the pad
outside off and up in the blockhole, Duminy misses
a poke, aiming to run the ball fine, but he misses
turned square, squirts to cover and Duminy, backing a long way, has to hurry home to beat the throw ... which misses
down the leg side, a good take, but no wide. Why not?
once more beaten outside the off stump
looks to drive straight but the ball squirms to midwicket
driven square for the single
hurriedly turned behind square, he had to jump but did well to keep it under control
too full and driven over long-on, a good follow through carried that just over the rope and wide of Fidel Edwards running round the boundary
firm drive to extra cover
a swish and a miss
pushed with an open face to third man
well driven behind square, Samuels hurtles round the boundary edge and makes a good sliding stop, digging up a big divot in the process to underline how soft the outfield is in this drizzle
cut hard to the deep cover area
push and run to the off
poor delivery, full on leg stump, Duminy helps it on its way to long leg - the man is up in the circle
a slash and a nick onto the keeper's pads but he was on his way up
turned to midwicket
back and pushed to the bowler
wide, Duminy cuts over it and Harper doesn't call it. South Africa can feel aggrieved as that was way outside the tram lines
driven to long-on, the throw is poor and Ontong gets back for two. Edwards is livid with his fielder
wide, slashed to deep cover, he really hammered that but right at the man
misses with a swing to leg, an appeal but nothing doing ... it was close though
turned off his legs behind square between the men in the deep
short but he mistimes a pull and the ball dribbles up to deepish mid-on
driven down the ground for two
ah, that's a neat stroke. It was in the slot and begging to be slogged over midwicket - and that's exactly what he did
nicely bowled - full and straight - and it's dug out
cracked on the front foot to mid-off's left. He didn't really get hold of it
outside off, guided to short third man who fields really well
chopped down to the off side
full, on his pads, he clips to long-on who stumbles a little in his pick-up
oh nicely bowled, angling it across the left hander who tried to dab it down to third man but missed
cracked on the back foot for a single to deep extra cover. But no! Four! It's through Powell's legs for four. That could be a match-turning cock-up
turned off his legs
driven off a thick outside edge down to third man
chopped down to third man. Clever stroke
full delivery - too full - and it's wide enough for Duminy to flay it behind square. Third man does well to sprint around the boundary, but his dive parries the ball over the rope
right in the slot and begging to be tonked through cover, but he mistimes it
again full, again wide, Duminy squeezes it to cover and sprints through for a single
oh that's rubbish from Powell...he's rattled. It's wild and woolly down the leg side
a good, short, rising delivery which he fends to leg for a hastily run single
clattered through cover and Samuels will field on the boundary...but he does so with one hand and lets it through, before scrabbling to claw it back. Sloppy fielding, but a good recovery
a casual flick to leg
swinging into the right hander who blocks
angled out to cover
oh, that's brilliantly run by this pair. Duminy defended, the ball dropping dead by his toes, and Ontong demanded him through for a single to leave West Indies standing static
angled into him, Ontong is quick to turn this  through midwicket
hammered on the front foot out to Samuels...who produces the long barrier this time
hit to mid-on whose  throw is wild and wide
down the leg side...and it's a wide

what a catch! What an amazing catch from Dwayne Bravo. A bouncer, Ontong tried to defend but got a leading edge up in the air. Bravo sprinted down the pitch and dived, full length, taking the ball while horizontal to the ground, about two feet from Ontong
punched back to the bowler
nudged to leg and Bravo sprints across to save a run
full and straight, he nudges to leg
down the leg side and a wide
an excellent, punchy, short-arm pull through midwicket
a slower ball which he works with industrious force to midwicket
squeezed to a deep mid-on
more inswing and he punches again to mid-on
smartly driven and he's placed it well, bisecting the covers and they'll pick up two
solidly thumped to the same region but he can't find the gap
pushed past Rampaul for a single
shorter delivery, he rocks back and pats it to third man
he gets a bottom edge to a cut, but Ramdin's pretty deep so it was perfectly safe
flayed with fury down to third man
calmly defended to mid-off
oh no - poor delivery and Duminy seizes on this short ball, pulling it around the corner. Fine leg hasn't a hope
a "walking drive" - reminded me of Michael Bevan, that stroke - but only for a single
this rises on Boucher who pulls around the corner
a full toss to begin with which he smacks out to deep extra cover
down the leg side, nudged to leg, no run
very well bowled - full, straight and fast. It's squeezed out for a single
ah, neat stroke from Duminy, just using the pace of the delivery to tease it down to third man
driven down the ground
fuller and quicker and punched back to the bowler
outside off, Boucher runs it down to third man
tucked to leg for a single
Boucher's playing this late, out to the off side
defended
short, punched to long-on
paddled around the corner for another single
more tip-and-run here as Duminy pushes this for a single out to the off side
turned down to fine leg
threaded into the deep for another easy single
a dot ball! Will wonders never cease? Boucher's smudging-drive to midwicket finds, well...it finds midwicket
defended on the front foot
Boucher is down the pitch and driving to mid-off
nudged to mid-on, no single there though
fuller, punched to mid-off
well bowled. A little short but it was nice and fast, and Duminy could only whip it back to him
nudged out to the off side, the bowler fields
an impatient edge, beaten by the quicker ball. He goes for an extravagant wide which flies past Ramdin
chopped down to the off side
down the leg side for another wide
down the pitch, Boucher opens the face and slices it down to Parchment who fields
ooh close! Nearly nudged it straight into Bravo's hands
elegantly driven out to deep extra...in comes the throw, but it's wide and they get a run
short, swung around the corner for four! South Africa are going to walk this
a slower ball which foxes Boucher who tries to whip it to leg, and gets a thick inside edge
edged past the keeper for another four! That wasn't far away from Ramdin at all
blimey, that's a massive, beaming wide. And a no-ball. It slipped out of his hand - it really is very wet
another four. Another poor ball down the leg side, Boucher just sits back, waits, and clips it neatly
nudged to leg
beautiful shot, jumping back into his crease and hammering it square of the wicket
beaten with a fine ball which cut back into him at the last moment. A big, booming drive
cracked square of the wicket
a hammering pull stroke but Bravo dives at midwicket to save four
well wide of the off stump, Duminy fetches it but can't get a single
angled to third man
down the leg side. Another wide
this sits up on Boucher who pulls it softly
firmly defended for a tip-and-run single
clipped through midwicket for a single
an ugly swish from Duminy, it flies through midwicket and there's the win for South Africa
